body:
- Logs now include microseconds (Thanks @ChefAustin!) #90
- Support for local manifests (Thanks @natewalck!) #98
- New "checkonly" mode and support for defining "blocking_apps" (Thanks @oktN!) #99
- Support for custom MSI installer arguments (Thanks @gleason86!) #100
- New versioning scheme as proposed by @erikng in #101

name: 1.0.0-beta.4
body:
Lots of changes since the last release:
- Improved path checks for uninstall items (Thanks @clburlison!) #79 #81
- Support script checks for uninstall items (Thanks @oktN!) #87
- Support registry checks for 32 bit apps (Thanks @oktN!) #89

name: 1.0.0-beta.3
body:
Lots of various changes that should make Gorilla more reliable!
- Various typos (Thanks @clburlison!) #66
- Update the way the configuration is processed to be more reliable. #67
- Handle errors more gracefully instead of causing a panic. #68
- Fix bug that caused `choco` output to be excluded when running in debug mode. #69
- Resolve issue that caused json report to not be saved after an error. #70
- Store catalogs and manifests in memory instead of writing and reading from disk. #73
- Use Chocolatey's recomended syntax for local nupkg files. #74
- Migrate from `dep` to `go mod` (Thanks @ChefAustin!). #76
- Added check to see if gorilla is running as an administrator. #78
- Miscellaneous unit tests.
- New logo (!)

name: 1.0.0-beta.2
body:
Beta 2 adds support for a local file repo. To use this feature, set the `url` using a `file://` protocol.

Example: `url: file://C:/ProgramData/gorilla/local/`

name: 1.0.0-beta.1
body:
First beta release!

During the beta period, Gorilla should not have any additional breaking changes. The catalog, manifest, and config format will not change. All code changes during beta should only be bug fixes or quality improvements.

**Feedback and bug reports are very welcome and it is a great time to try it out!**

To make it easer to get started, this release includes an optional MSI installer. The MSI will:
* Create `ProgramData\gorilla\bin\gorilla.exe`
* Create `ProgramData\gorilla\config_template.yaml`
* Add `ProgramData\gorilla\bin` to the system path
* Create a Scheduled Task that will run `gorilla.exe` every 60 minutes

name: 1.0.0-alpha.11
body:
Major restructuring of status check functionality and logic, with **a lot** of breaking changes to the catalog format: https://github.com/1dustindavis/gorilla/wiki/Catalogs

- Added ability to validate the version of a file
- Added ability to check more than one file
- Registry checks now have a specific configuration
- No checks are ran by default any longer
- Lots of new unit tests, which led to...
- Significant improvements to reliability and error handling within the `status` and `installer` packages

name: 1.0.0-alpha.10
body:
- Support for multiple catalogs and defining them in a manifest
- Many bug fixes for check scripts and check paths
- Many new unit tests
- Automated testing of pull requests via AppVeyor

**Breaking Changes:**
- Catalogs are now defined in a yaml array under the label `catalogs` instead of a string with the label `catalog`.

name: 1.0.0-alpha.9
body:
- A ton of little fixes implemented while writing unit tests
- Complete rewrite of the installer logic
- Adds more options when configuring an uninstaller
- Adds support for defining a separate URL for packages

**Breaking changes:**
- `installer_type` is required for all installs
- `uninstaller_type` is required for all uninstalls
- `cachepath` is no longer a configurable option
-  A sub folder of a new `app_data_path` will be used for caching

name: 1.0.0-alpha.8
body: This release fixes an issue where an uppercase `installer_item_hash` would be considered invalid.

name: 1.0.0-alpha.7
body:
- Support for http basic auth
- Support for TLS mutual auth
- Auto clean-up cached items older than 5 days
- Improved cli options and help

name: 1.0.0-alpha.6
body:
- Added exe installer support
- Now saving a report of what we have done to GorillaReport.json

name: 1.0.0-alpha.5
body:
- install_check_script is much more reliable
- Added default config location
- Refactored all logging, including a new --debug option

name: 1.0.0-alpha.4
body: Improved status checking, plus other minor changes.

name: 1.0.0-alpha.3
body: Support for `install_check_path` or `install_check_script` to determine if an item should be installed.

name: 1.0.0-alpha.2
body:
- Adds basic support for Powershell scripts, which allows for choco bootstrap.
- Other minor fixes
